bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Act:

bcl:text.#text: means an administrator or deputy administrator appointed under section 46 ;

means a contract for the sale of an interest in land under which the purchaser agrees to pay the purchase price over a period of time, in the manner stated in the contract, and on payment of which the vendor is obliged to transfer the interest in land to the purchaser;

bcl:link.in:doc: Land Title and Survey Authority Act

bcl:text.#text: means the Land Title and Survey Authority of British Columbia established under section 2 of the ;
, in relation to an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a trustee of a relevant trust, means an individual who is a beneficial owner within the meaning of section 2 ;
, in relation to a relevant corporation, means an individual who is a corporate interest holder within the meaning of section 3 ;

means a company, a body corporate, a body politic and corporate, an incorporated association or a society, however and wherever incorporated, but does not include a municipality or a corporation sole;
means a person in a class designated under section 26 ;
means an individual designated as the enforcement officer under section 50 , and

bcl:text.in:desc: [warrant to enter place to conduct inspection]
bcl:text.#text: for the purposes of the following sections, includes a person who is not an individual referred to in paragraph (a) and who is authorized to exercise powers under a warrant issued under section 55 :
section 54 ;
section 56 ;
section 78 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [records certified by enforcement officer as evidence]
bcl:text.#text: section 84 ;
section 86 ;

, in relation to an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report, means a legible paper copy of the electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report, containing every material provision and particular contained in the original, that is prepared for the purposes of certification under section 26 (3) ;
has the same meaning as in section 1 of the ;
means any of the following:
a band as defined in section 2 (1) of the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Nisg̱a'a Nation;
a Nisg̱a'a Village;

bcl:text.#text: the Sechelt Indian Band established by section 5 (1) of the  (Canada);
the Sechelt Indian Government District established by the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a Treaty First Nation;

bcl:text.#text: the Westbank First Nation as defined in the agreement approved under the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed Indigenous person or entity;

bcl:text.#text: means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a trustee of a relevant trust, a beneficial owner;
in relation to a relevant corporation, a corporate interest holder;
in relation to an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a partner of a relevant partnership, a partnership interest holder;

bcl:text.#text: means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an estate in fee simple;
a life estate in land;
a right to occupy land under a lease that has a term of more than 10 years;
a right under an agreement for sale to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: occupy land, or
require the transfer of an estate in fee simple;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed estate, right or interest;

bcl:text.#text: has the same meaning as in section 1 (1)  of the ;
means a permanent parcel identifier assigned to a parcel of land under section 58  of the ;
means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a partnership referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of "relevant partnership" in this section, a partner in the partnership;

in relation to a legal relationship described in paragraph (c) of the definition of "relevant partnership" in this section, a person who has, in respect of the legal relationship, powers and duties similar to those of a partner referred to in paragraph (a) of this definition;

bcl:text.#text: , in relation to an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a partner of a relevant partnership, means an individual who is presumed to be a partnership interest holder within the meaning of section 4 ;
means the following:

in relation to a partnership referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of "relevant partnership" in this section, an interest in land that is partnership property within the meaning of the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a legal relationship described in paragraph (c) of the definition of "relevant partnership" in this section, an interest in land that, in respect of the legal relationship, is similar to partnership property referred to in paragraph (a) of this definition;

bcl:link.in:doc: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act

bcl:text.#text: has the same meaning as in the ;
means the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [primary identification information — corporations and limited liability companies]
bcl:text.#text: in relation to a corporation or limited liability company, the information referred to in section 7 ;
in relation to an individual, the information referred to in section 8 (2) ;
in relation to a relevant partnership, the information referred to in section 9 ;
means information that, under section 30 (2) , is required to be made available for search by any person;
, when used as a verb in relation to land, means to register under the ;
means a corporation or limited liability company but does not include a corporation or limited liability company that is

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: referred to in Schedule 1, or
added by regulation to Schedule 1;

bcl:text.#text: means
a general partnership, limited partnership, limited liability partnership, professional partnership or foreign partnership within the meaning of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed partnership, or
a legal relationship, created in another jurisdiction, that is similar to a legal relationship referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of this definition
a prescribed partnership, or
a prescribed legal relationship;

bcl:text.#text: means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an express trust, including a bare trust,
a prescribed trust, or
a legal relationship, created in another jurisdiction, that is similar to a legal relationship referred to in paragraph (a) or (b)
a trust referred to in Schedule 2,
a trust added by regulation to Schedule 2, or
a legal relationship, created in another jurisdiction, that is similar to a legal relationship referred to in paragraph (d) or (e) of this definition;

bcl:text.#text: means information contained in transparency declarations and transparency reports filed under Part 2 ;
means any relevant corporation, trustee of a relevant trust or partner of a relevant partnership that is required to file a transparency report under any of the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required with application to register interest in land]
bcl:text.#text: section 12 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required from pre-existing and other owners]
bcl:text.#text: section 15 (1) or (4) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required if Surveyor of Taxes files transparency declaration]
bcl:text.#text: section 15.1 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required if new transparency declaration filed]
bcl:text.#text: section 15.2 (1) ;
, in relation to an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a trustee of a relevant trust, does not include a settlor who is also

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trustee of the relevant trust, or
a beneficial owner in respect of the interest in land;

bcl:text.#text: has the same meaning as in the ;
includes a grantee, an assignee and a person entitled by transmission to be a registered owner of an interest in land;
means a declaration under any of the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency declaration required with application to register interest in land]
bcl:text.#text: section 10 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency declaration required from Surveyor of Taxes]
bcl:text.#text: section 10.1 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [filing of new transparency declaration to correct previous declaration]
bcl:text.#text: section 10.2 (1) ;
means a report under any of the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required with application to register interest in land]
bcl:text.#text: section 12 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required from pre-existing and other owners]
bcl:text.#text: section 15 (1) or (4) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required if Surveyor of Taxes files transparency declaration]
bcl:text.#text: section 15.1 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required if new transparency declaration filed]
bcl:text.#text: section 15.2 (1) or (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required on change of interest holders or determination of incapacity]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [filing of new transparency report to correct previous report]
bcl:text.#text: section 17 (1) ;
means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a paper document or record, an exact copy of the document or record, and
in relation to an electronic document or record,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an exact copy of the document or record, or
a legible paper copy of the document or record containing every material provision and particular contained in the original;

bcl:text.#text: means the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in relation to a trust referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition of "relevant trust" in this section, a trustee of the trust;

in relation to a legal relationship described in paragraph (c) of the definition of "relevant trust" in this section, a person who has, in respect of the legal relationship, powers and duties similar to those of a trustee referred to in paragraph (a) of this definition.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meaning of "beneficial owner"
bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, an individual is a beneficial owner in respect of an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a trustee of a relevant trust if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual has, in respect of the interest in land, a beneficial interest, other than an interest that is contingent on the death of another individual;
the individual has the power to revoke the relevant trust and receive the interest in land;
the individual is a corporate interest holder in respect of a relevant corporation and the relevant corporation has

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a beneficial interest in respect of the interest in land, or
the power to revoke the relevant trust and receive the interest in land;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual has a prescribed interest, right or ability in relation to the interest in land, or a prescribed criterion or circumstance applies to the individual.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meaning of "corporate interest holder"

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: means an associate within the meaning of paragraph (c) or (d) of the definition of "associate" in section 192 (1)  of the ;
includes a person who owns through a trustee, personal or other legal representative, agent or other intermediary;

, in relation to a share issued by a relevant corporation, means a person who is a registered owner of the share within the meaning of the laws of the jurisdiction in which the relevant corporation is incorporated, organized, formed, continued or transferred;
, in respect of a relevant corporation, means either of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 10% or more of the issued shares of the relevant corporation;
issued shares of the relevant corporation that carry 10% or more of the rights to vote at general meetings.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, an individual is a corporate interest holder in respect of a relevant corporation if any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual has any of the following interests or rights, or any combination of them, in a significant number of shares of the relevant corporation:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an interest as a registered owner of one or more of the corporation's shares;
an interest as a beneficial owner of one or more of the corporation's shares, other than an interest that is contingent on the death of another individual;
indirect control, within the meaning of the regulations, of one or more of the corporation's shares;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual has any of the following rights or abilities, or any combination of them, that, if exercised, would result in the election, appointment or removal of the majority of the directors of the relevant corporation:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the right to elect, appoint or remove one or more of the corporation's directors;
indirect control, within the meaning of the regulations, of the right to elect, appoint or remove one or more of the corporation's directors;
the ability to exercise direct and significant influence over an individual who has the right or indirect control described in subparagraph (i) or (ii);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual has a prescribed interest, right or ability in relation to the relevant corporation, or a prescribed criterion or circumstance applies to the individual in relation to the relevant corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an interest or right referred to in subsection (2) in respect of a relevant corporation is held jointly by 2 or more individuals, each individual is a corporate interest holder in respect of the relevant corporation.

When 2 or more individuals have interests, rights or abilities that, when combined, meet a criterion described in subsection (2) (a), (b) or (c) in respect of a relevant corporation, each individual is a corporate interest holder in respect of the relevant corporation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the interests, rights or abilities are subject to an agreement or arrangement under which the interests, rights or abilities are to be exercised jointly or in concert by those individuals, or
each individual is an associate of the other individuals.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Meaning of "partnership interest holder"

bcl:text: For the purposes of this section, if
the individual or relevant corporation referred to in paragraph (a) is deemed to be a partner in the other relevant partnership referred to in paragraph (b).

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an individual or relevant corporation is a partner in a relevant partnership, and
the relevant partnership referred to in paragraph (a) is a partner in another relevant partnership,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3) and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, an individual is presumed to be a partnership interest holder in respect of an interest in land registered or to be registered in the name of a partner of a relevant partnership if the interest in land is partnership property and any of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual is a partner in the relevant partnership;
the individual is a corporate interest holder in respect of a relevant corporation and the relevant corporation is a partner in the relevant partnership;
the individual has a prescribed interest, right or ability in relation to the interest in land, or a prescribed criterion, circumstance or presumption applies to the individual.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The presumption under subsection (2) that an individual is a partnership interest holder in respect of an interest in land does not apply if the partner in whose name the interest in land is registered or to be registered can demonstrate that,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an individual who is a partner referred to in subsection (2) (a), the individual has no interest, right or ability, as a partner, in respect of the interest in land, or

in the case of an individual who is a corporate interest holder in respect of a relevant corporation referred to in subsection (2) (b), the relevant corporation has no interest, right or ability, as a partner, in respect of the interest in land.

bcl:text.#text: Unless the context indicates otherwise and subject to subsection (2), in this Act, , , ,  and  have the same meanings as in section 1  of the .

Transparency declarations, transparency reports and any other documents or records filed with or submitted, given or provided to the registrar or administrator under this Act are not instruments, documents or records filed, submitted, given, provided, deposited, registered, kept or lodged under the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Act does not apply to Indigenous land or prescribed land
bcl:section.bcl:text: This Act does not apply in relation to any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: treaty lands of a Treaty First Nation;
Nisg̱a'a Lands;
Nisg̱a'a Fee Simple Lands as defined in the Definitions Chapter of the Nisg̱a'a Final Agreement;

bcl:text.#text: Sechelt lands, as defined in section 2 (1) of the  (Canada);
a reserve, as defined in section 2 (1)  of the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Other Maa-nulth First Nation Lands as defined in the Definitions Chapter of the Maa-nulth First Nations Final Agreement;
Other Tla'amin Lands as defined in the Definitions Chapter of the Tla'amin Final Agreement;
Other Tsawwassen Lands as defined in the Definitions Chapter of the Tsawwassen First Nation Final Agreement;
prescribed land.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Primary identification information — corporations and limited liability companies
bcl:section.bcl:text: In a transparency report, primary identification information in respect of a corporation or limited liability company consists of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation's or company's name and registered office address;
if the corporation or company has a head office, the corporation's or company's head office address;
the jurisdiction in which the corporation or company was incorporated, organized or formed;
if the corporation or company has been continued or transferred into another jurisdiction, the jurisdiction into which the corporation or company was most recently continued or transferred;
prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Primary identification information — individuals

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:text.#text: has the same meaning as in the  (Canada);
means the usual place where an individual makes the individual's home.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In a transparency report, primary identification information in respect of an individual consists of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual's full name;
whether or not the individual is a Canadian citizen or permanent resident of Canada;
if the individual is not a Canadian citizen or permanent resident of Canada, every country or state of which the individual is a citizen;
if the individual's principal residence is in Canada, the city and province in which that principal residence is located;
if the individual's principal residence is outside Canada, the city and country in which that principal residence is located;
prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Primary identification information — relevant partnerships
bcl:section.bcl:text: In a transparency report, primary identification information in respect of a relevant partnership consists of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the partnership's registered business name, if any;
the type of partnership referred to in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of the definition of "relevant partnership" in section 1 that applies to the partnership;
the partnership's registered address or head office address, as applicable;
the address of the partnership's principal business premises;
the jurisdiction the laws of which govern

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the partnership, or
if the partnership has a partnership agreement, the interpretation of the partnership agreement;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency declaration required with application to register interest in land

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Unless section 10.1 applies, on an application to register an interest in land, each transferee must file with the administrator a transparency declaration that contains the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: whether or not the transferee is a reporting body;
if the transferee is a reporting body, whether or not the reporting body is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a relevant corporation,
a trustee of a relevant trust, or
a partner of a relevant partnership;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribed information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency declaration must be filed by submitting the declaration to the registrar, together with the application to register the interest in land.

bcl:text.in:desc: [certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: A transparency declaration submitted under subsection (2) must be certified in accordance with section 25 .
If the application to register referred to in subsection (2) is submitted under Part 10.1  of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transparency declaration must be

bcl:text.#text: signed in accordance with section 26  of this Act, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: submitted to the registrar electronically, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicable filing fee must be paid electronically.

bcl:text.#text: If the application to register referred to in subsection (2) is not submitted under Part 10.1 of the ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [how documents must be given to registrar or administrator]
bcl:text.#text: the transparency declaration must be submitted in the form and manner required by the administrator under section 87 (1)  of this Act, and

bcl:text.in:desc: [how fees must be paid to authority]
bcl:text.#text: the applicable filing fee must be paid at the time and in the manner required by the administrator under section 89 (1)  of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency declaration required from Surveyor of Taxes

bcl:text.#text: If, on behalf of a transferee, the Surveyor of Taxes makes an application to register an interest in land to reflect a vesting of the interest in the transferee under section 40 (2) or (5)  of the , the Surveyor of Taxes must file with the administrator a transparency declaration that contains the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the transferee;
the parcel identifier assigned to the land to which the declaration relates;

bcl:text.#text: the serial number, referred to in section 153 (1) (b)  of the , recorded on the most recent application previously received by the registrar in relation to the interest in land to which the declaration relates.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 10 (2), (4) and (5) applies in respect of a transparency declaration required under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of new transparency declaration to correct previous declaration

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency declaration required with application to register interest in land]
bcl:text.#text: A transferee may, at any time the transferee considers necessary in order to correct information contained in a transparency declaration previously filed under section 10 (1) , file with the administrator a new transparency declaration completed in accordance with that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency declaration under subsection (1) must be filed by submitting the declaration to the registrar.
Section 10 (3) to (5) applies in respect of a transparency declaration permitted under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refusal of application if transparency declaration not submitted, certified or signed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must refuse to accept an application to register an interest in land if a transferee fails to submit a transparency declaration with the application.
The registrar must refuse to accept an application to register an interest in land, and each transparency declaration submitted with the application, if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a transparency declaration that is submitted electronically, the requirements referred to in section 10 (4) are not met, or
in the case of a transparency declaration that is not submitted electronically,

bcl:text.in:desc: [certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: the declaration does not appear, on the face of that declaration, to be certified in accordance with section 25 , or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the requirements referred to in section 10 (5) are not met.

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency declaration required from Surveyor of Taxes]
bcl:text.#text: Despite subsection (2), the registrar may accept a transparency declaration filed under section 10.1 (1)  even if the declaration is not certified in accordance with section 25.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency report required with application to register interest in land

bcl:text: Subject to this section, section 13 and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, on an application to register an interest in land in the name of

bcl:text.#text: the corporation, trustee or partner must file with the administrator a transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3  of this Part.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a relevant corporation,
a trustee of a relevant trust, or
a partner of a relevant partnership,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency report required under this section must be filed by submitting the report to the registrar, together with the application to register the interest in land.

bcl:text.in:desc: [certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: A transparency report submitted under this section must be certified in accordance with section 25 .
If the application to register referred to in subsection (2) is submitted under Part 10.1  of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transparency report must be

bcl:text.#text: signed in accordance with section 26  of this Act, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: submitted to the registrar electronically, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicable filing fee must be paid electronically.

bcl:text.#text: If the application to register referred to in subsection (2) is not submitted under Part 10.1 of the ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [how documents must be given to registrar or administrator]
bcl:text.#text: the transparency report must be submitted in the form and manner required by the administrator under section 87 (1)  of this Act, and

bcl:text.in:desc: [how fees must be paid to authority]
bcl:text.#text: the applicable filing fee must be paid at the time and in the manner required by the administrator under section 89 (1)  of this Act.

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency declaration required from Surveyor of Taxes]
bcl:text.#text: A transparency report is not required under subsection (1) if, in relation to the interest in land, a transparency declaration is filed under section 10.1 (1) .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General rules for filing and completing transparency reports

bcl:text.#text: If a trustee of a relevant trust is required to file a transparency report under this Division, the requirement applies whether or not a trust instrument is or will be filed with the registrar under section 180  of the .

bcl:text: For the purposes of completing a transparency report, if

bcl:text.#text: the trustee must complete the transparency report in accordance with Division 3  of this Part as that Division is required to be applied by a trustee of a relevant trust and not as that Division is required to be applied by a relevant corporation.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trustee of a relevant trust is also a relevant corporation, and
the interest in land to which the transparency report relates is or will be held in trust,

bcl:text: For the purposes of completing a transparency report and unless subsection (4) applies, if
the partner must comply with Division 3 as that Division is required to be applied by a partner of a relevant partnership and not as that Division is required to be applied by a relevant corporation.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a partner of a relevant partnership is also a relevant corporation, and
the interest in land to which the transparency report relates is or will be partnership property,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If all of the partners in the relevant partnership referred to in subsection (3) are relevant corporations and the interest in land is or will be registered in the name of all of those relevant corporations, each of those partners must complete a transparency report in accordance with Division 3 as that Division is required to be applied by a relevant corporation.

bcl:text: For the purposes of completing a transparency report, if
the partner must comply with Division 3 as that Division is required to be applied by a partner of a relevant partnership and not as that Division is required to be applied by a relevant trust.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a partner of a relevant partnership is also a trustee of a relevant trust, and
the interest in land to which the transparency report relates is or will be partnership property,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A partner of a relevant partnership is not required to file a transparency report if all partners of the relevant partnership are individuals and the interest in land is or will be registered in the name of all of those individuals.

A trustee of a relevant trust is not required to file a transparency report if the interest in land is or will be registered in the name of all of the beneficial owners in respect of the interest in land.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Refusal of application if transparency report not submitted, certified or signed

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must refuse to accept an application to register an interest in land, and each transparency declaration submitted with the application, if both of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a transferee submits a transparency declaration that indicates that the interest in land is to be registered in the name of a reporting body;
the reporting body fails to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: submit a transparency report with the application, or
pay the applicable filing fee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must refuse to accept an application to register an interest in land, and each transparency declaration and transparency report submitted with the application, if one of the following applies:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a transparency report that is submitted electronically, the requirements referred to in section 12 (4) are not met;
in the case of a transparency report that is not submitted electronically,

bcl:text.in:desc: [certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: the report does not appear, on the face of that report, to be certified in accordance with section 25 , or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the requirements referred to in section 12 (5) are not met.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency report required from pre-existing and other owners

bcl:text.in:desc: [general rules for filing and completing transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to section 13 , this section and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, if, immediately before the coming into force of this section,

is a registered owner of an interest in land, the corporation, trustee or partner must, within the prescribed period, file with the administrator a transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3  of this Part.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a relevant corporation,
a trustee of a relevant trust, or
a partner of a relevant partnership

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registered owner of an interest in land is not required to file a transparency report under subsection (1) if, before the end of the prescribed period, the interest in land is registered in the name of another owner.
The following are not required to file a transparency report under subsection (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation or limited liability company if, before the end of the prescribed period, the corporation or limited liability company ceases to be a relevant corporation;
a trustee of a trust if, before the end of the prescribed period, the trust ceases to be a relevant trust;
a partner of a partnership if, before the end of the prescribed period, the partnership ceases to be a relevant partnership.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 13, this section and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, each of the following must file a transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation or limited liability company if the corporation or limited liability company

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is a relevant corporation,
is a registered owner of an interest in land, and
was not a relevant corporation at the time the interest in land was registered;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trustee of a trust if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the trust is a relevant trust,
the trustee is a registered owner of an interest in land, and
the trust was not a relevant trust at the time the interest in land was registered;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a partner of a partnership if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the partnership is a relevant partnership,
the partner is a registered owner of an interest in land, and
the partnership was not a relevant partnership at the time the interest in land was registered.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency report required under subsection (4) must be submitted within 2 months after the date on which

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation or limited liability company becomes a relevant corporation,
the trust becomes a relevant trust, or
the partnership becomes a relevant partnership.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency report required under this section must be filed by submitting the report to the registrar electronically.

bcl:text.in:desc: [certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: A transparency report submitted under this section must be certified in accordance with section 25 .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a transparency report is submitted under this section,

bcl:text.#text: the report must be signed in accordance with section 26 , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicable filing fee must be paid electronically.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The registrar must refuse to accept a transparency report submitted under this section if the requirements referred to in subsection (8) are not met.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency report required if Surveyor of Taxes files transparency declaration

bcl:text.in:desc: [general rules for filing and completing transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to section 13 , this section and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, if, in relation to an interest in land,

in:desc: [transparency declaration required from Surveyor of Taxes]
bcl:text.#text: is a transferee on whose behalf the Surveyor of Taxes has filed a transparency declaration under section 10.1 (1) , the corporation, trustee or partner must file with the administrator a transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3  of this Part.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a relevant corporation,
a trustee of a relevant trust, or
a partner of a relevant partnership

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency report required under subsection (1) must be submitted within 2 months after the corporation, trustee or partner becomes aware or reasonably ought to have become aware that the Surveyor of Taxes has filed the transparency declaration under section 10.1 (1).
Section 15 (6) to (9) applies in respect of a transparency report required under this section.

Despite subsection (1), a relevant corporation, a trustee of a relevant trust or a partner of a relevant partnership is not required to file a transparency report under this section if the corporation, trustee or partner is no longer a registered owner of the interest in land to which the transparency declaration relates.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency report required if new transparency declaration filed

in:desc: [general rules for filing and completing transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to section 13 , this section and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, a relevant corporation, a trustee of a relevant trust or a partner of a relevant partnership must file with the administrator a transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3  of this Part if, in relation to an interest in land,

bcl:text.in:desc: [filing of new transparency declaration to correct previous declaration]
bcl:text.#text: the corporation, trustee or partner filed a new transparency declaration under section 10.2 (1) ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required with application to register interest in land]
bcl:text.#text: the corporation, trustee or partner did not previously file a transparency report under section 12 (1)  with the application to register the interest in land, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a transparency report should have been filed under section 12 (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to section 13, this section and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, a reporting body must file with the administrator a new transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3 if, in relation to an interest in land, the reporting body filed a new transparency declaration under section 10.2 (1).
A transparency report required under subsection (1) or (2) must be submitted at the same time the transparency declaration is filed under section 10.2 (1).
Section 15 (6) to (9) applies in respect of a transparency report required under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transparency report required on change of interest holders or determination of incapacity

bcl:text.in:desc: [general rules for filing and completing transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to section 13 , this section and the exemptions, if any, in the regulations, within 2 months after a reporting body becomes aware or reasonably ought to have become aware that
the reporting body must file with the administrator a new transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3  of this Part.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the previous transparency report filed by the reporting body no longer discloses the current interest holders, or

bcl:text.#text: a determination of incapacity referred to in section 22  has been made in respect of an interest holder,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 15 (6) to (9) applies in respect of a transparency report required under this section.

Despite subsection (1), a reporting body is not required to file a transparency report under this section if the reporting body is no longer the registered owner of the interest in land to which the previous transparency report relates.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Filing of new transparency report to correct previous report

in:desc: [general rules for filing and completing transparency reports]
[transparency report required if new transparency declaration filed]
bcl:text.#text: Subject to section 13  and subsection (2) of this section, and without limiting sections 15.2 (2)  and 16, a reporting body may, at any time the reporting body considers necessary in order to complete or correct information contained in a previously filed transparency report, file with the administrator a new transparency report completed in accordance with Division 3  of this Part.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 15 (6) to (9) applies in respect of a transparency report permitted to be filed under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice required if corporation, trust or partnership ceases to be relevant corporation, relevant trust or relevant partnership

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A corporation or limited liability company that is a registered owner of an interest in land must give notice to the administrator if, after the corporation or limited liability company has filed a transparency report, the corporation or limited liability company ceases to be a relevant corporation.
A trustee that is a registered owner of an interest in land must give notice to the administrator if, after the trustee has filed a transparency report, the trust ceases to be a relevant trust.

A partner that is a registered owner of an interest in land must give notice to the administrator if, after the partner has filed a transparency report, the partnership ceases to be a relevant partnership.
A notice under this section must be given to the administrator, together with the applicable fee, within 2 months after the date on which

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation or limited liability company ceases to be a relevant corporation,
the trust ceases to be a relevant trust, or
the partnership ceases to be a relevant partnership.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Information required in transparency reports
bcl:section.bcl:text: A transparency report filed by a reporting body must contain the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the reporting body's primary identification information;
the information required under section 19 in respect of each interest holder;
if the reporting body is a relevant corporation,

bcl:text.#text: the relevant corporation's business number, if any, within the meaning of the  (Canada), and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the incorporation, continuation, amalgamation or other identifying number or designation given to the relevant corporation by the jurisdiction in which the relevant corporation is incorporated, organized, formed, continued or transferred;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the reporting body is a trustee of a relevant trust,

bcl:text.#text: the information required under section 20  in respect of each settlor, and
the reference number, if any, of the trust instrument registered under section 180  of the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the reporting body is a partner of a relevant partnership,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the relevant partnership's primary identification information,

bcl:text.#text: the relevant partnership's business number, if any, within the meaning of the  (Canada), and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the identifying number, if any, issued to the partnership by the jurisdiction identified under subparagraph (i);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the parcel identifier assigned to the land to which the report relates;

bcl:text.in:desc: [certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports]
bcl:text.#text: in respect of the individual who is certifying the report in accordance with section 25 , the individual's name, position name or title, telephone number and email address;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Information about interest holders
bcl:section.bcl:text: A transparency report filed by a reporting body must contain the following information in respect of each individual who is an interest holder:

bcl:text.in:desc: [requirements if unable to obtain information about interest holders or settlors]
bcl:text.#text: subject to section 21 ,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the individual's primary identification information,
the individual's date of birth,
the individual's last known address,
the individual's social insurance number, if any,
the individual tax number, if any, assigned to the individual by the Canada Revenue Agency,

bcl:text.#text: whether or not the individual is resident in Canada for the purposes of the  (Canada),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the date on which the individual became an interest holder, and
a description of how the individual is an interest holder;

bcl:text.#text: if the reporting body knows, as a result of steps taken under section 22 , that a determination of incapacity has been made in respect of the individual, a statement setting this out;
the information required under section 24 (2) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Information about settlors
bcl:section.bcl:text: A transparency report filed by a reporting body that is a trustee of a relevant trust must contain the following information in respect of each settlor of the trust:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a settlor who is an individual,

bcl:text.in:desc: [requirements if unable to obtain information about interest holders or settlors]
bcl:text.#text: subject to section 21 , the information referred to in section 19 (a) (i) to (vi), and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the information referred to in section 19 (b), if applicable;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a settlor that is a corporation or limited liability company and subject to section 21, the corporation's or company's primary identification information;
in any case,

bcl:text.#text: the information required under section 24 (2) , and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Requirements if unable to obtain information about interest holders or settlors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A reporting body must take reasonable steps to obtain and confirm the accuracy of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the information required under section 19 (a) in respect of each interest holder,
if the reporting body is a trustee of a relevant trust, the information required under section 20 (a) (i) and (b) in respect of each settlor, and
prescribed information, if any.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a reporting body that is a relevant corporation determines that there are no individuals who are corporate interest holders, or if a reporting body that is a partner of a relevant partnership determines that there are no individuals who are partnership interest holders, the transparency report must contain a statement setting this out.

If a reporting body that is a trustee of a relevant trust determines that there are no individuals who are beneficial owners, the transparency report must contain a description of each class of beneficiaries of the relevant trust.

If a reporting body is unable to obtain or confirm the accuracy of some or all of the information referred to in subsection (1) in respect of an interest holder or settlor, as applicable, the transparency report must contain the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the information referred to in subsection (1) that the reporting body was able to obtain or confirm in respect of the interest holder or settlor;
for information referred to in subsection (1) that the reporting body was not able to obtain or confirm, a summary of the steps taken to obtain or confirm the information;
prescribed information, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Identification of incapacity
bcl:section.bcl:text: If, at any time, a reporting body becomes aware that an individual who is an interest holder or settlor may be incapable of managing the individual's financial affairs, the reporting body must take reasonable steps to determine whether, in respect of that individual, a determination of incapacity has been made by a court, health authority designate or prescribed person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Interest holder's duty to give information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of completing and filing a transparency report, a reporting body may, at any time by written request, require that a person who is or may be an interest holder or settlor, as applicable, provide the reporting body with information.

After receiving a request under subsection (1) and taking reasonable steps to compile the requested information, a person must give to the reporting body a written statement setting out the information that the person was able to compile.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice to interest holders and settlors

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before filing a transparency report, a reporting body must take reasonable steps to give written notice of the following to each interest holder and settlor required to be identified in the report:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that information about the interest holder or settlor is required under this Division for the purposes of completing and filing a transparency report;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application to omit information if health or safety at risk]
bcl:text.#text: that an individual has the right under section 40  to request that some or all of the information in relation to the individual be omitted from or obscured in publicly accessible information;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that unless an individual makes a request under section 40 within 90 days after the filing of a transparency report, the information in relation to the individual will be publicly accessible after the end of that 90-day period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency report filed by a reporting body must contain the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a list of the interest holders and settlors to whom the reporting body was able to give notice under subsection (1);
for the interest holders and settlors to whom the reporting body was not able to give notice under subsection (1), a summary of the steps taken to give notice to those interest holders and settlors.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within 7 days after submitting a transparency report, a reporting body must take reasonable steps to give to each interest holder and settlor, as applicable, an extract from the report showing the information contained in the report in respect of the interest holder or settlor.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Certification of transparency declarations and transparency reports

bcl:text.#text: A transparency declaration or transparency report submitted by a transferee or reporting body must, if the transferee or reporting body is a person other than an individual, be certified to be correct and complete, to the extent required under Division 3  of this Part, by an individual who has

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: knowledge of the matters certified, and
actual authority to certify the declaration or report on behalf of the transferee or reporting body.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transparency declaration or transparency report submitted by a transferee or reporting body must, if the transferee or reporting body is an individual, be certified to be correct and complete, to the extent required under Division 3, by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transferee or reporting body, or
an agent of the transferee or reporting body who has knowledge of the matters certified.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Electronic signing

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator may designate classes of persons as authorized to certify electronic transparency declarations and electronic transparency reports under this section.

Before a transferee or reporting body submits an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report to the registrar, the electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: signed electronically by the transferee or reporting body in accordance with the policies established by the administrator, or
certified under this section by a designate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before the Surveyor of Taxes submits an electronic transparency declaration to the registrar, the electronic transparency declaration must be signed electronically by the Surveyor of Taxes in accordance with the policies established by the administrator.
An electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report is certified under this section by a designate if the electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: includes a statement that the electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report is certified under this section by the designate, and
is signed electronically by the designate in accordance with the policies established by the administrator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The electronic signature by a designate of an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report described in subsection (3) is a certification by the designate that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an execution copy of the electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report has been certified in accordance with section 25, and
the execution copy referred to in paragraph (a), or a true copy of that execution copy, is in the possession of the designate.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report that is signed electronically by the transferee or reporting body is submitted to the registrar, the transferee or reporting body must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: retain a true copy of the electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report for a period established by the administrator, and
produce the true copy for inspection if requested by the administrator during that period.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report that is certified under this section by a designate is submitted to the registrar, the transferee or reporting body, as applicable, and the persons, if any, that are specified in the policies established by the administrator must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: retain the execution copy referred to in subsection (4) (a) of this section, or a true copy of that execution copy, for the period established by the administrator, and
produce that execution copy or true copy for inspection if requested by the administrator during that period.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibitions in relation to electronic signing
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must not do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: wilfully make a false certification under section 26 (3);
sign an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report using an electronic signature of another person;
permit an electronic signature of the person to be used by another person to sign an electronic transparency declaration or electronic transparency report.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Access to Transparency Records, Reported Information and Publicly Accessible Information

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions for Part 3
bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Part:

bcl:text.#text: means any of the following:
the British Columbia Securities Commission continued under the ;
the BC Financial Services Authority established under section 2 of the ;

bcl:link.in:doc: Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act

bcl:text.#text: the Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada established under the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the Law Society of British Columbia;
a prescribed public officer, corporation, agency or other entity whose authority to regulate is based on a law of British Columbia or Canada;

bcl:text.#text: means the portion of the government of British Columbia or Canada responsible for administering or enforcing

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a law of British Columbia or Canada that provides for the imposition or collection of a tax, royalty or duty, or
a prescribed law of British Columbia or Canada that is related to a law referred to in paragraph (a);

bcl:text.#text: means transparency declarations and transparency reports filed under Part 2 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Administrator's duty to keep and maintain records and information
bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to and in accordance with this Act and the regulations, the administrator must keep and maintain the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: transparency records;
reported information and publicly accessible information;
applications given to the administrator in respect of proposed inspections and searches under this Part;
applications given to the administrator under the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [application to omit information if health or safety at risk]
bcl:text.#text: section 40 ;
section 42 ;
verification and proofs provided to the administrator under section 58 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all other documents and records received by the administrator under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Administrator's duty to make information available

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to and in accordance with this Act and the regulations, the administrator must make transparency records available for inspection and reported information available for search under the following provisions:

bcl:text.in:desc: [inspections and searches by enforcement officers and ministry officials]
bcl:text.#text: section 31 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [inspections and searches for tax and related purposes]
bcl:text.#text: section 32 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [inspections and searches for law enforcement purposes]
bcl:text.#text: section 33 ;
section 34 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of the regulations.

bcl:text.#text: Subject to and in accordance with this Act and the regulations, the administrator must make the following information contained in transparency records available through searches conducted under section 35 :

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: primary identification information in respect of reporting bodies that are identified as registered owners of interests in land;
primary identification information in respect of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: individuals who are identified as interest holders in relation to

bcl:clause.bcl:text: the reporting bodies referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection, or
the interests in land in respect of which the reporting bodies referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection are identified as registered owners, and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: in the case of reporting bodies referred to in paragraph (a) of this subsection that are trustees of relevant trusts, persons who are identified as settlors of the relevant trusts;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: parcel identifiers for parcels of land in relation to which persons are identified as reporting bodies, interest holders or settlors;
prescribed information, if any.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator must take reasonable steps to ensure that the information to be made available under subsection (2) relates to persons who are, at the time of the search, identified as reporting bodies, interest holders or settlors.

The following information, as that information relates to an individual who is identified as an interest holder or settlor, must not be made publicly accessible under subsection (2) until at least 90 days after the transparency report to which the information relates has been accepted by the registrar for filing with the administrator:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: primary identification information;
parcel identifiers for parcels of land in relation to which the individual is identified as an interest holder or settlor.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty, the requirement under subsection (4) (b) that parcel identifiers must not be made publicly accessible as information that relates to an individual identified as an interest holder or settlor does not affect the requirement under subsection (2) (b.1) that parcel identifiers must be made publicly accessible as information that relates to a person identified as a reporting body.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inspections and searches by enforcement officer and ministry officials

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The enforcement officer may inspect transparency records and search reported information for the purposes of determining compliance with this Act and the regulations.
An official or employee of the ministry of the Minister of Finance may inspect transparency records and search reported information for any of the following purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the compilation of statistical information by the government;
the formulation or evaluation by the government of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: fiscal policy, or
policy to combat the laundering of proceeds of crime;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed purpose.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A prescribed official or employee of the government may inspect transparency records and search reported information for prescribed purposes.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inspections and searches for tax and related purposes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An official or employee of a taxing authority may inspect transparency records and search reported information for the following purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: administering or enforcing

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a law of British Columbia or Canada that provides for the imposition or collection of a tax, royalty or duty, or
a prescribed law of British Columbia or Canada that is related to a law referred to in subparagraph (i);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: providing information contained in a transparency declaration or transparency report to another jurisdiction in or outside Canada to assist the jurisdiction in the administration or enforcement of a law of that jurisdiction that provides for the imposition or collection of a tax, royalty or duty if this assistance is authorized under an arrangement, written agreement, treaty or law of British Columbia or Canada.

bcl:text.#text: An official or employee of the British Columbia Assessment Authority may inspect transparency records and search reported information for the purpose of administering or enforcing the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inspections and searches for law enforcement purposes

bcl:text.#text: An officer within the meaning of the  or a member of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police may inspect transparency records and search reported information for the following purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: conducting an investigation in Canada

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: that is undertaken with a view to a law enforcement proceeding, or
from which a law enforcement proceeding is likely to result;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: policing or criminal intelligence operations in Canada;
assisting another law enforcement agency in Canada for a purpose described in paragraph (a) or (b);

providing information contained in a transparency declaration or transparency report to a law enforcement agency in a jurisdiction outside Canada to assist the agency in a law enforcement proceeding if this assistance is authorized under an arrangement, written agreement, treaty or law of British Columbia or Canada.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inspections and searches by regulators
bcl:section.bcl:text: An official or employee of a regulator may inspect transparency records and search reported information for the following purposes:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: administering or enforcing a law for which the regulator is responsible;
assisting another agency in Canada in the administration or enforcement of a law that is similar to a law for which a regulator is responsible;

providing information contained in a transparency declaration or transparency report to an agency outside Canada to assist the agency in the administration or enforcement of a law that is similar to a law for which the regulator is responsible if this assistance is authorized under an arrangement, written agreement, treaty or law of British Columbia or Canada.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Searches by members of public
bcl:section.bcl:text: Subject to reasonable conditions that the administrator may impose, a person may obtain publicly accessible information by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: searching for the name of a person to ascertain the parcel identifiers for the parcels of land in relation to which the person is identified as a reporting body, interest holder or settlor,
searching for the parcel identifier for a parcel of land to ascertain the persons who are identified as reporting bodies, interest holders or settlors in relation to the parcel of land, or
conducting a prescribed search.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Manner of conducting inspections and searches
bcl:section.bcl:text: The administrator may do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specify the manner in which an inspection or search must be conducted under this Part;
require that a proposed inspection or search under this Part be accompanied by an application that contains the information and is completed in the manner required by the administrator.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Restrictions on inspections and searches
bcl:section.bcl:text: The regulations may impose restrictions on inspections or searches authorized under any of the following:

bcl:text.in:desc: [inspections and searches for tax and related purposes]
bcl:text.#text: section 32 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [inspections and searches for law enforcement purposes]
bcl:text.#text: section 33 ;
section 34 ;
section 35 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Fees for inspections and searches
bcl:section.bcl:text: Unless exempted under the regulations, a person or entity must pay the applicable fees before the person or entity does any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: inspects transparency records or searches reported information or publicly accessible information;
obtains from the administrator copies of or extracts from transparency records, reported information or publicly accessible information.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Mandatory omission of information from publicly accessible information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Primary identification information in respect of an individual and parcel identifiers for parcels of land in relation to which the individual is identified must be omitted from or obscured in publicly accessible information if the transparency report containing the information indicates that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual is under 19 years of age, or
a court, health authority designate or prescribed official has determined that the individual is incapable of managing the individual's financial affairs.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following information must be omitted from or obscured in publicly accessible information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: information specified in an application under section 40 (1) unless the administrator is required or authorized under section 40 (4) or 41 (1) to cease omitting or obscuring that information;
prescribed information, if any.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For certainty, information in the form of parcel identifiers

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must be omitted from or obscured in publicly accessible information, as that information relates to individuals to whom subsection (1) or (2) applies, and
must not be omitted from or obscured in publicly accessible information, as that information relates to persons other than individuals to whom subsection (1) or (2) applies.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to omit information if health or safety at risk

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An individual may, by application to the administrator, request that some or all of the information in relation to the individual that would otherwise be publicly accessible be omitted from or obscured in publicly accessible information if the individual believes that making that information publicly accessible could reasonably be expected to threaten the safety or mental or physical health of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the individual, or
a member of the individual's household.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant under this section must do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specify in the application

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the grounds on which the application is based,
the particular information the individual seeks to have omitted or obscured, and
the address at which the individual is to be notified of the administrator's decision under section 41 (2);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: give the application to the administrator, together with the applicable fee;
provide to the administrator any other records, information and verifications the administrator may require.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Promptly after receiving an application under this section, the administrator must omit from or obscure in publicly accessible information the information specified by the applicant under subsection (2) (a) (ii).

Despite subsection (3), the administrator must cease omitting from or obscuring in publicly accessible information the information specified by an applicant under subsection (2) (a) (ii) if the applicant fails to provide, within the time specified by the administrator, any records, information or verifications required under subsection (2) (c).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determination of application to omit information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator may, subject to subsection (3), cease omitting from or obscuring in publicly accessible information some or all of the information that an applicant specifies under section 40 (2) (a) (ii) if the administrator is satisfied that making some or all of that information publicly accessible could not reasonably be expected to threaten the safety or mental or physical health of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the applicant, or
a member of the applicant's household.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator must give to the applicant written notice of a decision made under subsection (1).
The administrator may not cease omitting or obscuring information under subsection (1) until at least 30 days after giving notice under subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application to correct or change information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person other than a person who was a reporting body may, by application to the administrator, request that corrections or changes be made to a filed transparency report, reported information or publicly accessible information if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transparency report, reported information or publicly accessible information contains incomplete or inaccurate information about the person,

bcl:text.in:desc: [filing of new transparency report to correct previous report]
bcl:text.#text: the person has, by written request to the reporting body that provided the information, requested that the reporting body correct or change the information by filing a new transparency report under section 17 , and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the reporting body has not, within 3 months after receiving the person's request, filed a new transparency report that contains complete and accurate information about the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who was a reporting body may, by application to the administrator, request that corrections or changes be made to a filed transparency report, reported information or publicly accessible information if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transparency report, reported information or publicly accessible information contains incomplete or inaccurate information, and

in the case of a request that a correction or change be made to information in relation to an interest holder or settlor, the person has taken reasonable steps to give written notice of the requested correction or change to the interest holder or settlor.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An applicant under subsection (1) or (1.1) must do the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: specify in the application

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the particular information the applicant considers to be incomplete or inaccurate,
the reasons why the applicant considers that information to be incomplete or inaccurate, and
the address at which the applicant is to be notified of the administrator's decision under section 43 (3);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of an applicant under subsection (1), include in the application a copy of the request referred to in paragraph (b) of that subsection;
in the case of an applicant under subsection (1.1) who requests a correction or change in relation to an interest holder or settlor, include the following information in the application:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: whether or not the applicant was able to give notice of the requested correction or change to the interest holder or settlor;
if the applicant was not able to give notice, a summary of the steps taken to give notice to the interest holder or settlor;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: give the application to the administrator, together with the applicable filing fee;
provide to the administrator any other records, information and verifications the administrator may require.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determination of application to correct or change information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an applicant under section 42 seeks corrections or changes to information contained in a filed transparency report, the administrator may, if satisfied that the information specified by the applicant under section 42 (2) (a) (i) is incomplete or inaccurate, annotate the transparency report so that some or all of the necessary corrections or changes are noted.

If an applicant under section 42 seeks corrections or changes to information in reported information or publicly accessible information, the administrator may, if satisfied that the information specified by the applicant under section 42 (2) (a) (i) is incomplete or inaccurate, do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: make changes to, remove information from or add information to reported information or publicly accessible information to reflect some or all of the necessary corrections or changes;
annotate reported information or publicly accessible information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator must give to the applicant written notice of a decision made under this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Omissions, changes or annotations on administrator's initiative
bcl:section.bcl:text: The administrator may, on the administrator's own initiative, do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: omit information from or obscure information in publicly accessible information if the administrator considers that making that information publicly accessible could reasonably be expected to threaten the safety or mental or physical health of an individual;
annotate a filed transparency report;
make changes to, remove information from, add information to or annotate reported information or publicly accessible information.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Omissions, changes or annotations required by enforcement officer
bcl:section.bcl:text: The administrator must, if requested to do so in writing by the enforcement officer for the purposes of completing or correcting information that the enforcement officer has determined is incomplete or inaccurate,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: omit information from or obscure information in publicly accessible information,
annotate a filed transparency report, or
make changes to, remove information from, add information to or annotate reported information or publicly accessible information.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Appointment of administrator and deputy administrators
bcl:section.bcl:text: The chief executive officer of the authority

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must appoint an employee of the authority as the administrator, and
may appoint employees of the authority as deputy administrators.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General responsibilities of administrator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting other powers or duties of the administrator under this Act, and subject to general policy direction given by the minister, the administrator is responsible for the general administration of this Act and the regulations.
The administrator may develop and provide public information and education respecting this Act and the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Administrator must report to minister
bcl:section.bcl:text: The administrator must report to the minister, as required by the minister, on

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the administration of this Act and the regulations, and
other matters the minister considers necessary in relation to this Act and the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delegation of administrator's powers and duties

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator may delegate to any person any of the administrator's powers or duties under this Act.
A delegation under subsection (1) may be to a named person or to a class of persons.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Designation of enforcement officer

bcl:text.#text: The minister may designate as the enforcement officer an individual appointed under the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General responsibilities of enforcement officer

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting other powers or duties of the enforcement officer under this Act, and subject to general policy direction given by the minister, the enforcement officer is responsible for the general enforcement of this Act and the regulations.
The enforcement officer may develop and provide public information and education respecting this Act and the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Delegation of enforcement officer's powers and duties

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The enforcement officer may delegate to any person any of the enforcement officer's powers and duties under this Act.
A delegation under subsection (1) may be to a named person or to a class of persons.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Enforcement officer's entry and inspection powers

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The enforcement officer may conduct inspections under this section for the purposes of determining compliance with this Act and the regulations.
For the purposes of conducting an inspection, the enforcement officer may, at any reasonable time and subject to subsection (3), enter a place where

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a reporting body carries on business, or
records relating to a reporting body are kept.

bcl:text.in:desc: [warrant to enter place to conduct inspection]
bcl:text.#text: Except as authorized by a warrant issued under section 55 , the enforcement officer may enter a place occupied as a private residence only with the consent of the owner or occupier of the private residence.
Subject to section 56 , the enforcement officer may do any of the following at a place the enforcement officer is authorized to enter under this section:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: inspect records and things that may be relevant to the inspection;
obtain information, including personal information, relevant to the inspection;
remove a record or thing for the purposes of inspecting the record or thing;
remove a record for the purposes of making copies or extracts of the record.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: When conducting an inspection, the enforcement officer must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carry identification and present the identification on request, and
advise the owner, manager or person apparently in charge of the place in which the inspection is being conducted of the reason for the inspection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the enforcement officer removes a record or thing from a place, the enforcement officer must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: provide a receipt for the record or thing, and
return the record or thing within a reasonable time.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Duty to cooperate with inspection

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On request of the enforcement officer, an occupant of a place that the enforcement officer is authorized to enter under section 53 or a warrant issued under section 55 must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: promptly allow the enforcement officer to enter the place, and
facilitate the enforcement officer's inspection.
