bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who has possession or control of records, things or information that the enforcement officer is entitled to inspect or obtain under section 53 or a warrant issued under section 55 must promptly produce or provide access to the records, things or information as required by the enforcement officer.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Warrant to enter place to conduct inspection

bcl:text.#text: If a justice is satisfied by evidence on oath or affirmation that there are reasonable grounds to believe that there are, in a private residence or in any other place, records or things relevant to determining compliance with this Act and the regulations, the justice may issue a warrant authorizing the enforcement officer or another person named in the warrant to enter the place in accordance with the warrant in order to exercise the powers referred to in section 53 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records in possession of lawyer
bcl:section.bcl:text: Except in accordance with the regulations, the enforcement officer's power to inspect records under section 53 or a warrant issued under section 55 must not be used to inspect records in the possession of a lawyer if the lawyer, at the time the records are about to be inspected, claims that a client or former client of the lawyer has solicitor-client privilege in relation to those records.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Demand for information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of determining compliance with this Act and the regulations, the enforcement officer may, by demand notice, require a person to provide

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a written statement on matters specified in the demand notice, or
a record specified in the demand notice.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person to whom a demand notice is given under this section must provide the required written statements and records

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: within the time specified in the notice, and

bcl:text.in:desc: [how documents must be given to enforcement officer]
bcl:text.#text: in the form and manner required under section 88 .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Demand for verification or proof
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person must, if requested in writing to do so by the administrator or enforcement officer,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: verify that a transparency declaration, transparency report or other document or record filed, submitted, given or provided under this Act is accurate and complete, and
provide proof of a fact stated in a document or record referred to in paragraph (a) of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of administrative penalty

bcl:text.#text: The enforcement officer may give written notice to a person requiring the person to pay an administrative penalty if the enforcement officer, after considering the factors set out in section 60 , determines that the person has contravened the Act by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: failing to file a transparency report required under

bcl:text.#text: section 15 (1) (a), (b) or (c) ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required from owners who become reporting bodies after registration]
bcl:text.#text: section 15 (4) (a), (b) or (c) , or

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required on change of interest holders]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) (a) or (b) ,
filing a transparency report that does not comply with a requirement under Part 2 ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [prohibition against providing false or misleading information in transparency declaration or transparency report]
bcl:text.#text: contravening section 75 (1) (a) or (b) , or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contravening a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The enforcement officer may give written notice to a person requiring the person to pay an administrative penalty if the enforcement officer, after considering the factors set out in section 60, determines that the person has contravened any of the following:

bcl:text.#text: section 23 (2) ;
section 27 (a), (b) or (c) ;
section 57 (2) ;
section 58 (a) or (b) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [prohibition against providing false or misleading information in other documents or records]
[prohibition against misuse of information obtained by reporting body]
bcl:text.#text: section 76 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [prohibition against misuse of publicly accessible information]
bcl:text.#text: section 77 (a), (b) or (c) ;
section 78 (a), (b) or (c) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A determination under this section may be based on information obtained from an inspection or from any other source.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Factors enforcement officer must consider

bcl:text.#text: Before the enforcement officer imposes an administrative penalty on a person for a contravention referred to in section 59 (1) or (2) , the enforcement officer must consider the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: previous enforcement actions against the person under this Act;
the gravity and magnitude of the contravention;
whether the contravention was repeated or continuous;
whether the contravention was deliberate;
any economic benefit derived by the person from the contravention;
the person's efforts to correct the contravention.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amount of administrative penalty

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An administrative penalty for a contravention referred to in section 59 (1) must not exceed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a contravention by a person other than an individual, the greater of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 5% of the assessed value of the property to which the transparency declaration or transparency report relates, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a contravention by an individual, the greater of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: 5% of the assessed value of the property to which the transparency declaration or transparency report relates.

bcl:text.#text: For the purposes of subsection (1),  means the most recent assessed value, as determined under the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An administrative penalty for a contravention referred to in section 59 (2) must not exceed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a contravention by a person other than an individual, $50 000, or
in the case of a contravention by an individual, $25 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Content of notice of administrative penalty

bcl:text.#text: A notice of administrative penalty for a contravention referred to in section 59 (1) or (2)  must specify the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contravention;
the amount of the administrative penalty;
the date by which the administrative penalty must be paid;

bcl:text.#text: the person's right under section 64 (1)  to request an opportunity to dispute the administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Due date of administrative penalty

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person on whom an administrative penalty is imposed must pay the administrative penalty to the government on or before the latest of the following dates, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 14 days after the date on which the person is given notice under section 59 (1) or (2);

bcl:text.#text: if the person disputes the administrative penalty in accordance with section 64 (1) and (3), 90 days after the date on which the person is given notice under section 65 (3)  of the enforcement officer's decision, unless that decision rescinds the administrative penalty;

if the person appeals the administrative penalty in accordance with section 66 (1) , 30 days after the date on which the person is given notice under section 67 (3)  of the minister's decision, unless that decision rescinds the administrative penalty.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the date that an administrative penalty is payable under subsection (1), the penalty constitutes a debt payable to the government by the person on whom the administrative penalty is imposed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Opportunity to dispute administrative penalty

bcl:text.#text: A person who receives notice of an administrative penalty under section 59 (1) or (2)  may, within 14 days after receiving the notice, give written notice to the enforcement officer requesting an opportunity to dispute

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contravention, or
the amount of the administrative penalty.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt by the enforcement officer of a written notice of request under subsection (1), the administrative penalty to which the request applies is stayed.

A person who gives a written notice of request under subsection (1) must give to the enforcement officer, within 30 days after receiving notice of the administrative penalty, a written statement setting out

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the material facts, and
the reasons for disputing, as applicable,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the contravention, or
the amount of the administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Enforcement officer's decision

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within a reasonable time after receiving a written statement under section 64 (3), the enforcement officer must confirm, vary or rescind the contravention and the amount of the administrative penalty, as applicable.

The dispute of an administrative penalty under this section may be conducted in writing, electronically or orally, or any combination of them, as the enforcement officer, in the enforcement officer's discretion, considers appropriate.

Promptly after making a decision under subsection (1), the enforcement officer must give to the person to whom the decision relates written notice of the decision, including notice of the following, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contravention, as confirmed or varied by the enforcement officer;
the amount of the administrative penalty, as confirmed or varied by the enforcement officer;
the date by which the administrative penalty must be paid;
the person's right under section 66 (1) to appeal the enforcement officer's decision to the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Appeal to minister

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who receives notice under section 65 (3) of a decision confirming or varying an administrative penalty may, within 90 days after receiving the notice, appeal the decision to the minister by giving a written notice of appeal that sets out

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the material facts, and
the reasons for appealing, as applicable,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the contravention, or
the amount of the administrative penalty.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On receipt by the minister of a written notice of appeal under subsection (1), the administrative penalty to which the appeal relates is stayed.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Minister's decision

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Within a reasonable time after receiving a written notice of appeal under section 66 (1), the minister must affirm, vary or rescind the contravention and the amount of the administrative penalty, as applicable.

The appeal of an administrative penalty under this section may be conducted in writing, electronically or orally, or any combination of them, as the minister, in the minister's discretion, considers appropriate.

Promptly after making a decision under subsection (1), the minister must give to the person to whom the decision relates written notice of the decision, including notice of the following, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contravention, as affirmed or varied by the minister;
the amount of the administrative penalty, as affirmed or varied by the minister;
the date by which the administrative penalty must be paid;
the date under section 68 by which an application for judicial review, if pursued, must be commenced.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may, in writing, delegate any of the minister's powers or duties under this section.
A delegation under subsection (4) may be to a named person or to a class of persons.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Time limit for judicial review
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a person makes an application for judicial review of a decision made by the minister under section 67 (1), the application must be commenced within 30 days after the date on which the person receives written notice under section 67 (3).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Relationship between administrative penalties and offences

bcl:text.#text: If an administrative penalty is imposed on a person under this Division, a prosecution for an offence under Part 6  for the same contravention may not be brought against the person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who has been charged with an offence under Part 6 may not be subject to an administrative penalty in respect of the circumstances that gave rise to the charge.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Administrative penalty against officers or directors of corporation
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the enforcement officer determines that a corporation or limited liability company has contravened this Act or the regulations, the enforcement officer may, in accordance with this Division, impose an administrative penalty on an officer, director, manager or agent of the corporation or limited liability company who authorized, permitted or participated in the contravention.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Time limit for imposing administrative penalty
bcl:section.bcl:text: Notice of an administrative penalty for a contravention under this Division must not be given more than 6 years after the date on which the act or omission that is alleged to constitute the contravention occurred.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Summary proceedings to enforce administrative penalty

bcl:text.#text: In this section and sections 73 and 74,  means an amount remaining unpaid on an administrative penalty and any interest on that amount.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person fails to pay an amount owing to the government in respect of an administrative penalty imposed under this Act, the enforcement officer may issue a certificate setting out the unpaid amount of the administrative penalty and the name of the person who owes it.
A certificate issued under subsection (2) may be filed with the Provincial Court or Supreme Court.

A certificate filed under subsection (3) has the same force and effect, and all proceedings may be taken on the certificate, as if it were a judgment of the court in favour of the government for the recovery of a debt in the amount specified in the certificate against the person named in the certificate.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Lien to enforce administrative penalty

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a person fails to pay an amount owing to the government in respect of an administrative penalty imposed under this Act, the enforcement officer may register a lien against the real property of the person by registering a certificate of lien in the appropriate land title office.
A certificate of lien under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: state the amount owing,
be in the prescribed form, and

bcl:text.#text: be registered in the same manner that a charge is registered under the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On registration under subsection (1) of a certificate of lien against real property, a lien is created on the real property for the amount owing in respect of the administrative penalty.
On the oral or written request of a person, the enforcement officer must disclose in writing the amount of the lien registered under this section against the real property of the person.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Notice of enforcement proceedings

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Before taking proceedings for the recovery of an amount owing to the government in respect of an administrative penalty, the enforcement officer must give to the person who owes the amount notice of the enforcement officer's intention to enforce payment.
Failure to give notice under subsection (1) does not affect the validity of proceedings taken for the recovery of an amount owing in respect of an administrative penalty.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition against providing false or misleading information

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not provide false or misleading information in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a transparency declaration, or
a transparency report.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person must not provide false or misleading information in any of the following documents or records:

bcl:text.#text: a written statement given to a reporting body under section 23 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [Access to Transparency Records, Reported Information and Publicly Accessible Information]
bcl:text.#text: an application given to the administrator in respect of a proposed search or inspection under Part 3 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [application to omit information if health or safety at risk]
bcl:text.#text: an application, record or verification given to the administrator under section 40 (2) (b) or (c) ;
an application, record or verification given to the administrator under section 42 (2) (c) or (d) ;
a written statement or record provided to the enforcement officer under section 57 (2) ;
a verification or proof provided to the administrator or enforcement officer under section 58 ;
a written statement given to the enforcement officer under section 64 (3) ;
a written notice of appeal given to the minister under section 66 (1) .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who omits a material fact from the information contained in a document or record referred to in subsection (1) or (2) contravenes that subsection if the omission of the material fact makes the information false or misleading.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition against misuse of information obtained by reporting body
bcl:section.bcl:text: A reporting body that obtains personal information for the purposes of this Act in respect of an interest holder or settlor must not disclose or use the personal information except as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purpose of filing transparency declarations and transparency reports with the administrator;
to provide information under this Act to the administrator, enforcement officer or minister;
with the consent of the individual to whom the information relates;
as required or authorized by law;
for prescribed purposes, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition against misuse of publicly accessible information
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who obtains information from publicly accessible information must not use or disclose the information

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to solicit persons by telephone, mail or other means,
to harass persons, or
for prescribed purposes, if any.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Prohibition against interfering with inspection

bcl:text.#text: If the enforcement officer is conducting an inspection authorized under section 53 , a person must not do any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: obstruct the enforcement officer in conducting the inspection;
withhold, destroy, conceal or refuse to provide or produce information, records or things required by the enforcement officer or otherwise related to the inspection;
provide false or misleading records or information.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Personal liability protection

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister;
the administrator;
the enforcement officer;

bcl:text.in:desc: [warrant to enter place to conduct inspection]
bcl:text.#text: a person acting under the authority of a warrant issued under section 55 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a person acting for or under the direction of a person referred to in any of paragraphs (a) to (d) of this subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), no legal proceeding for damages lies or may be commenced or maintained against a protected person because of anything done or omitted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the exercise or intended exercise of any power under this Act, or
in the performance or intended performance of any duty under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) does not apply to a protected person in relation to anything done or omitted in bad faith.

Subsection (2) does not absolve the authority or the government from vicarious liability arising out of anything done or omitted by a protected person for which the authority or the government would be vicariously liable if this section were not in force.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Registrar not required to inquire into information
bcl:section.bcl:text: The registrar is not required, for the purpose of determining the completeness or accuracy of information or for any other reason, to inquire into information contained in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: transparency declarations, transparency reports or any other documents or records submitted, given or provided to the registrar under this Act, or
reported information or publicly accessible information.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records vest in authority

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following documents and records vest in the authority:

bcl:text.#text: transparency declarations and transparency reports filed with the administrator under Part 2 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [Access to Transparency Records, Reported Information and Publicly Accessible Information]
bcl:text.#text: applications given to the administrator in respect of proposed inspections and searches under Part 3 ;

in:desc: [application to omit information if health or safety at risk]
bcl:text.#text: applications, verifications and any other documents or records given to the administrator under sections 40 (2) (b) and (c)  and 42 (2) (c) and (d) ;
verifications and proofs provided to the administrator under section 58 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other documents or records filed with or submitted, given or provided to the administrator under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are not subject to any process of attachment, execution or seizure:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: documents and records referred to in subsection (1);
reported information;
publicly accessible information.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite any Act, agreement or court order, a receiver must not exercise custody or control over any of the documents, records or information referred to in subsection (2).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Disposal of records

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Documents and records referred to in section 81 (1) must be kept in the location approved by the board of directors of the authority.
Documents and records referred to in section 81 (1) may be destroyed or disposed of only in accordance with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bylaws of the authority, or

bcl:text.in:desc: [status of assets if Authority is dissolved]

bcl:link.in:doc: Land Title and Survey Authority Act

bcl:text.#text: section 3  of the .

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records certified by administrator as evidence

bcl:text.#text: A copy of a document or record referred to in section 81 (1)  that is

bcl:text: is conclusive evidence of the document or record and is admissible in court as if it were the original.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: obtained from the administrator, and
certified by the administrator to be a true copy

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A certification by the administrator under subsection (1) in respect of an electronic document or record is conclusive evidence that the copy was made by the administrator in the usual and ordinary course of business using procedures and techniques that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: are capable of recording all significant details of the original electronic document or record, and
do not permit additions to or deletions or changes from the original electronic document or record.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Records certified by enforcement officer as evidence

bcl:text.#text: A copy or extract certified by the enforcement officer as being a true copy of a document, record or extract inspected or obtained by the enforcement officer under Division 3  of Part 4  is admissible in evidence to the same extent as, and has the same evidentiary value as, the original document, record or thing, without proof of the signature of the enforcement officer.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Administrator exempted from attendance as witness in court

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The administrator, in the administrator's official capacity, is not bound by a subpoena, order or summons issued in a civil proceeding

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to attend outside of the office of the authority as a witness for examination, or
to produce in a place that is outside the office of the authority a document or record filed with or submitted, given or provided to the administrator under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) applies whether or not the subpoena, order or summons is directed to the administrator in the administrator's personal or official capacity.
The administrator may be examined and may produce documents and records at the office of the authority under a commission or similar order for the examination of a witness.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Enforcement officer not compellable

bcl:text.#text: The enforcement officer must not be compelled to disclose any information, document, record or thing obtained under Division 3  of Part 4  unless the disclosure is necessary for the administration or enforcement of this Act or is otherwise required by law.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How documents must be given to registrar or administrator

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who files, submits, gives or provides a document or record that is any of the following must file, submit, give or provide the document or record in the form and manner required by the administrator:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a transparency declaration or transparency report, except to the extent this Act requires the declaration or report to be signed or submitted electronically;

bcl:text.in:desc: [notice required if corporation, trust or partnership ceases to be relevant corporation, relevant trust or relevant partnership]
bcl:text.#text: a notice under section 17.1 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [omissions, changes or annotations required by enforcement officer]
bcl:text.#text: a written request under section 45 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a document or record referred to in section 81 (1) (b), (c) or (d);
any other document or record required or permitted under this Act to be filed with or submitted, given or provided to the registrar or administrator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), in establishing requirements under that subsection the administrator may do any of the following:

bcl:text.#text: provide that specified provisions of the  and the  apply, in whole or in part, with any additions and modifications that the administrator considers appropriate;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: require officers, designates or other persons to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: file, submit, give or provide a document or record electronically,
certify, sign, attest to, witness or prove execution of a document or record, and
verify the identity of a person

bcl:clause.bcl:text: who files, submits, gives or provides a document or record, or
on whose behalf a document or record is filed, submitted, given or provided.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How documents must be given to enforcement officer

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who gives or provides a document or record that is any of the following must give or provide the document or record in the form and manner required by the enforcement officer:

bcl:text.#text: a written statement or record under section 57 (2) ;
a verification or proof requested by the enforcement officer under section 58 ;
a written notice of request under section 64 (1) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a written statement under section 64 (3);

bcl:text.#text: a written notice of appeal under section 66 (1) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other document or record required or permitted under this Act to be given or provided to the enforcement officer.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the enforcement officer may require that a written statement referred to in subsection (1) (a) or a verification or proof referred to in subsection (1) (b) be provided by way of affidavit or statutory declaration.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How fees must be paid to authority

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who is required to pay a fee that is any of the following must pay the fee to the authority at the time and in the manner required by the administrator:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a filing fee for a transparency declaration or transparency report, except to the extent this Act requires the fee to be paid electronically;

bcl:text.in:desc: [notice required if corporation, trust or partnership ceases to be relevant corporation, relevant trust or relevant partnership]
bcl:text.#text: a fee for a notice under section 17.1 ;
a fee for an inspection, search, copy or extract referred to in section 38 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a fee for an application under

bcl:text.in:desc: [application to omit information if health or safety at risk]
bcl:text.#text: section 40 , or
section 42 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a fee for any other service provided by the administrator under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority's board of directors may set fees referred to in subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How administrator must give documents

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A request, notice or other document or record that the administrator is required or authorized to give to a person under any of the following must be given in the prescribed manner:

bcl:text.#text: section 41 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [determination of application to correct or change information]
bcl:text.#text: section 43 (3) ;
section 58 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A request, notice, order or other document or record referred to in subsection (1) that is given to a person in a prescribed manner is conclusively deemed to be received by the person at the time prescribed in relation to the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: How enforcement officer must give documents

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A request, notice or other document or record that the enforcement officer or minister is required or authorized to give to a person under any of the following must be given in the prescribed manner:

bcl:text.#text: section 57 (1) ;
section 58 ;
section 59 (1) or (2) ;
section 65 (3) ;
section 67 (3) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A request, notice, order or other document or record referred to in subsection (1) that is given to a person in a prescribed manner is conclusively deemed to be received by the person at the time prescribed in relation to the prescribed manner.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Offences relating to transparency declarations and transparency reports

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who does any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fails to file a transparency report required under

bcl:text.#text: section 15 (1) (a), (b) or (c) ,

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required from owners who become reporting bodies after registration]
bcl:text.#text: section 15 (4) (a), (b) or (c) , or

bcl:text.in:desc: [transparency report required on change of interest holders]
bcl:text.#text: section 16 (1) (a) or (b) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [prohibition against providing false or misleading information in transparency declaration or transparency report]
bcl:text.#text: contravenes section 75 (1) (a) or (b) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: contravenes a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than an individual, that commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine of not more than the greater of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 15% of the assessed value of the property to which the transparency declaration or transparency report relates.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An individual who commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine of not more than the greater of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 15% of the assessed value of the property to which the transparency declaration or transparency report relates.

bcl:text.#text: For the purposes of subsections (2) and (3),  means the most recent assessed value, as determined under the Assessment Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Other offences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes any of the following commits an offence:

bcl:text.#text: section 23 (2) ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [prohibition against providing false or misleading information in other documents or records]
[prohibition against misuse of information obtained by reporting body]
bcl:text.#text: section 76 ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [prohibition against misuse of publicly accessible information]
bcl:text.#text: section 77 (a), (b) or (c) ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a prescribed provision of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person, other than an individual, that commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine of not more than $100 000.
An individual who commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine of not more than $50 000.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Offence by officer or director of corporation
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a corporation or limited liability company commits an offence under this Act, an officer, director, manager or agent of a corporation or limited liability company who authorizes, permits or participates in the commission of the offence also commits an offence, whether or not the corporation or limited liability company is prosecuted or convicted.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Time limit for prosecuting offence
bcl:section.bcl:text: The time limit for laying an information for an offence under this Act is 6 years after the date on which the act or omission that is alleged to constitute the offence occurred.

bcl:text.#text: Section 5  of the  does not apply to this Act or the regulations.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: General regulation-making authority

bcl:text.#text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41  of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: respecting any matter for which regulations are contemplated by this Act;
defining any word or expression used but not defined in this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The authority to make regulations under another provision of this Act does not limit subsections (1) and (2) of this section.
In making a regulation under this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may do one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delegate a matter to a person;
confer a discretion on a person;
make different regulations in relation to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: different persons, entities, places, circumstances, transactions, trusts, partnerships, interests in land, reports, information, matters or things, or
different classes of persons, entities, places, circumstances, transactions, trusts, partnerships, interests in land, reports, information, matters or things;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish or define classes of persons, entities, places, circumstances, transactions, trusts, partnerships, interests in land, reports, information, matters or things.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations in relation to Schedules 1 and 2

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation, do any of the following:

bcl:text.#text: for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "relevant corporation" in section 1 , add corporations or limited liability companies to Schedule 1 by adding new provisions to that Schedule;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delete corporations or limited liability companies from Schedule 1 by amending or repealing provisions added under paragraph (a) of this subsection.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, by regulation, do any of the following:

bcl:text.#text: for the purposes of paragraph (e) of the definition of "relevant trust" in section 1 , add trusts to Schedule 2 by adding new provisions to that Schedule;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: delete trusts from Schedule 2 by amending or repealing provisions added under paragraph (a) of this subsection.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations in relation to meaning of "indirect control"
bcl:section.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations respecting the meaning of "indirect control" for the purposes of section 3 (2) (a) (iii) or (b) (ii), including regulations establishing criteria or circumstances that are based on the ownership of shares, even though the ownership of the shares does not result in control.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations in relation to lawyers' records

bcl:text.#text: In this section,  means a record or part of a record to which all of the following apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the record or part is in the possession of a lawyer;
the record or part is about to be

in:desc: [warrant to enter place to conduct inspection]
bcl:text.#text: inspected or removed for the purposes of an inspection under section 53  or a warrant issued under section 55 , or
seized for the purposes of the investigation of an offence under Part 6 ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at the time the record or part is about to be inspected, removed or seized, the lawyer, in respect of that record or part, makes a claim of solicitor-client privilege for a client or former client.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations in relation to lawyers' records as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establishing procedures for allowing a lawyer's record to be retained or seized and held in a secure manner until

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the claim of solicitor-client privilege is waived by the lawyer's client or former client, or
the claim is determined, or the lawyer's record is otherwise dealt with, on application to the Supreme Court in accordance with the regulations;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establishing a right to apply to the Supreme Court to resolve a claim of solicitor-client privilege regarding a lawyer's record retained or seized under paragraph (a) and establishing how the court is to deal with such an application.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations in relation to exemptions
bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite any other provision of this Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations providing for exemptions, in whole or in part, from one or more provisions of this Act or the regulations, including, without limitation, regulations doing one or more of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: exempting a person from a requirement to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: file a transparency declaration or transparency report,
include or disclose specified information in a transparency report, or
pay a fee;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establishing circumstances in which an exemption applies;
setting conditions in respect of, or limitations on, the application of an exemption.

bcl:schedule.bcl:schedulesubtitle: Excluded Corporations and Limited Liability Companies

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exclusions under paragraph (a) of definition of "relevant corporation"
bcl:section.bcl:text: A corporation or limited liability company that is any of the following is not a relevant corporation:

bcl:text.#text: a corporation within the government reporting entity as defined in the ;
a government body within the meaning of section 1 of the ;

bcl:text.in:doc: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act
bcl:text.#text: a local public body within the meaning of the ;

bcl:text.in:doc: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act
bcl:text.#text: a body referred to in Schedule 2  of the ;
a corporation incorporated by a municipality under section 185  of the ;

bcl:text.in:desc: [inspector approval required for incorporation or acquisition of corporations]
bcl:text.#text: a corporation incorporated by a regional district under section 265  of the ;
a corporation that is a reporting issuer or reporting issuer equivalent within the meaning of the ;
a corporation that is listed on a designated stock exchange within the meaning of section 248 (1) of the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation incorporated or continued by an enactment;

bcl:text.#text: a water utility within the meaning of the ;
a designated airport authority within the meaning of the  (Canada);
a port authority within the meaning of the  (Canada);
a corporation that operates an independent school within the meaning of the ;
a strata corporation within the meaning of the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a savings institution;
an insurance company;
a trust company;

bcl:text.#text: a pension fund society within the meaning of the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation that is wholly owned by one or more Indigenous nations;

bcl:text.#text: a wholly owned subsidiary, within the meaning of the , of a corporation to which any of paragraphs (a) to (s) of this section apply.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exclusions under paragraph (b) of definition of "relevant corporation"
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are not relevant corporations:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation that, under an Act of Canada or a province, is an agent of Canada or a province;
a corporation of which Canada or a province directly owns more than 50% of the issued voting shares;

a corporation controlled by the government of Canada or a province and, for this purpose, a corporation is controlled by the government if a majority of the corporation's members, board of directors or board of management consists of either or both of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: persons appointed as members by

bcl:clause.bcl:text: an executive legislative body of the government,
a minister of the government, or
an Act of Canada or a province;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: public officers acting as public officers;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation incorporated, continued or amalgamated by an Act of Canada or a province;

bcl:text.#text: a wholly owned subsidiary, within the meaning of the , of a corporation referred to in paragraph (d).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exclusions under paragraph (d) of definition of "relevant trust"
bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are not relevant trusts:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a charitable trust;
a testamentary trust;

bcl:text.#text: an alter ego trust or joint spousal or common-law partner trust within the meaning of the  (Canada);

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trust the trustee of which is the Public Guardian and Trustee;
a trust the trustee of which is an administrator of an estate;
a trust in respect of a pension plan registered under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a pension enactment of British Columbia, or
the pension legislation of another province or Canada;

bcl:text.#text: a trust in respect of a pooled registered pension plan within the meaning of the ;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trust in respect of which each beneficiary is an Indigenous nation;

bcl:text.#text: property vested in a person licensed or appointed under the  (Canada);
a mutual fund trust within the meaning of the  (Canada);
a SIFT trust within the meaning of the  (Canada).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exclusions under paragraph (e) of definition of "relevant trust"

bcl:text.#text: A real estate investment trust within the meaning of the  (Canada) is not a relevant trust.
